Job Details

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.

Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

Overview:

Do you excel in an environment that values exploration and discovery? We have a universe of opportunities waiting for you!
 
The Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL) is NASA’s leading center for robotic exploration of the solar system. Our core competency is the end-to-end implementation of unprecedented robotic space missions to study Earth, the Solar System, and the Universe.
 
The Instrument Software and Science Data Systems Section (Section 398) within JPL consists of multidisciplinary teams of engineers and data scientists who provide expertise across the domains of instrument operations, science data systems, and science support.

Section 398 has the responsibility to:

  • Deliver the Instrument Operations System (IOS) to an instrument team or flight mission.  The IOS is the integrated set of people, processes, procedures, software, hardware, and facilities with the capability to plan and command instrument observations, as well as control and monitor instrument performance.
  • Deliver the Science Data System (SDS) to an instrument team, flight mission, or science project. The SDS is the integrated set of software, hardware, facilities, people and procedures with the capability to process, manage, distribute, explore, and analyze scientific data.
  • Provide data science services that enable and support JPL scientific investigations and goals.
  • Provide science project management and science system engineering support to JPL and NASA programs and projects.
  • Provide software engineering and development support to instrument and science teams.

Will Statement:

  • Join the Science Data System Operations Engineering (398N) as the SDS Operations Lead.
  • Administratively and technically report to the 398N Technical Group Supervisor and programmatically to the Project Manager.
  • Serve as an archive systems Operations Lead and be the operational authority for the project’s archive system, data publication process, and user support. 

Responsibilities:

  • Direct all aspects of a project’s SDS operations, including planning and implementation of budget, success metrics, and milestones.
  • Develop long-term strategic plans for evolving data system’s operational responsibilities, including evolution of data center operations in the cloud.
  • Manage operational interactions and coordination with data providers and missions.
  • Develop the processes and procedures that support data curation, ingest, and archive. 
  • Coordinate the workflow necessary for publication of datasets into the data system, ensuring timely release of datasets following the project’s data and system engineering principles. 
  • Foster collaborations with the wider NASA-DAAC/EOSDIS user communities in order to provide the appropriate levels of service and tools for data discovery, access, and analysis.
  • Actively engage and collaborate with operations team, project systems engineers, and development team towards implementation of best practices and guidelines.

Required Skills:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, with typically a minimum of 9 years of related experience; Master’s degree in relevant discipline with a minimum of 7 years of related experience; or PhD in in relevant discipline with a minimum of 5 years related experience.
  • Demonstrated ability to perform, lead, and deliver operational functions at a large data archive level (e.g., PO.DAAC)  including the ability to form and lead a multidisciplinary, cross-system team inside of JPL.
  • Ability to lead the activities of, and to synthesize the unique discipline knowledge of, a broad range of technical subject matter experts.
  • Ability to deal with multiple issues, tasks, and priorities concurrently.
  • Proven Experience in Science Data System (SDS) operations.
  • Experience in Earth science data, metadata, and related standards.
  • Demonstrated leadership and successful record of product delivery (integrated system, hardware or software subsystem, data products, technology).
  • Proven ability to work with managers and engineers in several disciplines and lab organizations and multiple system contractors.

Desired Skills:

  • Thorough understanding of science data systems operations, methods, and applications.
  • Recent technical task management and software systems engineering experience.
  • Experience in all phases of the design, development, system integration, test, and operation of data systems (e.g. archives).
  • Experience in conducting and/or participating in a system-level verification program for a complex system.
  • Demonstrated skills in leading a multidisciplinary, multi-organizational team.
  • Ability to work on major project assignments without appreciable direction with accountability for technical performance.
  • Significant understanding and wide application of advanced principles, theories, concepts, and techniques in data system operations.
  • Experience leading tasks and coordinating working groups on projects in system development, test, verification, and operations.
  • Experience with agile development, planning, and delivery of system requirements, deliverables, milestones and resources.
  • Experience in working with cloud services (e.g., Amazon AWS) and with cloud-based architectures.

JPL has a catalog of benefits and perks that span from the traditional to the unique. This includes a variety of health, dental, vision, wellbeing, and retirement plans, paid time off, learning, rideshare, childcare, flexible schedule, parental leave and many more. Our focus is on work-life balance, and living healthy, fulfilling lives as we Dare Mighty Things Together. For benefits eligible positions, benefits are effective the first day of the month coincident with or immediately following the employee’s start date.

For further benefits information click Benefits and Perks
